summary: This is an email chain from October 4, 2021, regarding the production of discovery materials in the case United States v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330). It involves coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell concerning the delivery of discovery to her at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).

persons.context: Listed as a recipient in the 'Cc' field of the initial email regarding discovery production for Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.context: The accused in the case 'US v. Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)'. The discovery production is being sent to the MDC for her.

events.title: Discovery Production Coordination
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York coordinates with defense counsel to produce additional discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is an email regarding the ongoing discovery process in United States v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
Ghislaine Maxwell was incarcerated at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) as of October 2021.
The U.S. Attorney's Office was producing discovery via USAfx and physical media (CD or drive) for the defendant.
The defense team included attorneys Christian Everdell, Mark S. Cohen, Laura Menninger, Jeff Pagliuca, and Bobbi Sternheim.
The correspondence shows procedural coordination between prosecution and defense regarding evidence sharing.
